By contrast, organic meat is often full of character but also just 0.5-3% of the meat we produce; less than 1% of the meat we actually eat.

Alternative proteins will take a while to match these flavours. Plus you make money by cannibalising 50% of the market, not 1%.

Alternative proteins target the products of industrial meat farming(burgers, bangers, nuggets): these meat products are easy to replicate, in texture and taste. They're ~50% of the meat we eat.

As we make meat cheap, we make it taste less characterful. That makes APs easy.
